results.title: Food for Sport (+Booklet)
results.brief_description: Karen Inge, a Melbourne based dietician and Peter Beukner, doctor to the Australian Swimming team, present eight golden rules for sound sports nutrition. Booklet available.

results.title: Follow the leader
results.brief_description: A supervisory training film which makes use of puppets. Designed to increase employee pride in and identification with the organisation. It also aims to make employees understand and be proud of their job and their skill at performing it.

results.title: Follow my leader
results.brief_description: A Girl Guide Company requires a new leader. No-one is available so the Company carries on as best it can. Finally the Guides erect notices promoting a display of what they do and before too long they get a volunteer for a new leader and also new recruits.

results.title: Folk dances today
results.creator_credit: Mario Casetto and F A Film Associates
results.brief_description: At a teenagers’ dance party it is the “in” thing to do Greek and Armenian line dances, the Swedish “hambo”, middle eastern “debkas”, and Bulgarian “kolos”. The film cuts away to show each ethnic dance, or type, performed by exhibition groups with authentic styling in national costumes.

results.title: Folk art
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of home crafts. A wood carver creating complex scenes and individual figures; women painting the walls of their homes with brightly colored floral designs; a potter making and decorating attractive pieces of pottery; expert needle women designing and working intricate pieces of embroidery.

results.title: Foetal surgery
results.brief_description: A 4 1/2 month pregnant monkey (the equivalent to 7 months in human terms), has its foetus operated on to create a condition that occurs in human babies - the short bowel syndrome, for later study under laboratory conditions. When the baby monkey was born there was virtually no scar tissue, and the foetus had replaced enough of the removed bowel to survive.
results.description: A 4 1/2 month pregnant monkey (the equivalent to 7 months in human terms), has its foetus operated on to create a condition that occurs in human babies - the short bowel syndrome, for later study under laboratory conditions. When the baby monkey was born there was virtually no scar tissue, and the foetus had replaced enough of the removed bowel to survive.

results.title: Flying the flag : the story of the Eureka flag
results.creator_credit: Jo Lane, Debra Annear and Vixen Films
results.brief_description: This production examines the events associated with the Eureka Stockade, which occurred at Ballarat, Victoria, on 3rd December 1854. The Eureka flag was unfurled by protesting diggers on Bakery Hill prior to the Stockade, a potent symbol of their fight for democracy and human rights in a new land. The issues investgated include the flag’s design, manufacture, conservation and the sometimes debatable uses made of it by political groups. This video draws in a wealth of material provided by the Ballarat Fine Art Gallery and the Public Record Office of Victoria, as well as interviews with a number of people directly associated with conserving and promoting the flag in the 20th century.

results.title: Flying seeds
results.brief_description: Uses time-lapse photography and close-ups in a study of plant mechanisms for distributing seeds by air. Shows how wind borne seeds and those which scatter, explode or catapult, free themselves from the parent plant and travel through the air.
results.description: Uses time-lapse photography and close-ups in a study of plant mechanisms for distributing seeds by air. Shows how wind borne seeds and those which scatter, explode or catapult, free themselves from the parent plant and travel through the air.

results.title: Flying doctor
results.brief_description: A factual film of a unique Australian service: “By aeroplane and radio the Flying Doctor Service and the Commonwealth Air Ambulance Service bring medical aid to the thinly populated areas of Australia’s vast inland. At Broken Hill base, where this film as photographed, Dr John Wood cares for patients in an area of over 500,000 square miles”. Photography by Lionel Trainor.
